title: EarnOnVictor
author: EarnOnVictor
created_time: April 26, 2023, 08:13:37 AMLast edit: April 26, 2023, 03:02:51 PM by EarnOnVictor
content: Hi guys!This has been on my mind for a while now, though I'm not a coder yet I've seen it on many forums and websites and it had availed my work from being lost many times in the past. If possible on BTT, I believe it's time that we have the 'autosave draft function' on the forum. I'm somewhat aware of what this could take but a unique forum like this is long overdue for it.I don't know about you, but I've lost many of my drafted posts/topics due to my multitask attitude, system/browser malfunction, personal error and other reasons, which could be painful.A simple function that could save our drafts as we type (provided the browser is connected to the internet) will go a long way.Thanks!#Edit: For those who doubt if it's possible, see an example that I just deliberately did on a forum below:

comments.author: KingsDen
comments.body: A whole new idea could easily be implemented by theymos, but re-implementing what is already in use might not be accepted. While multitasking, before I'll leave bitcointalk tab, I'll simply preview and that automatically saves my work as draft and it will be there for days.I have never lost any work due to this.

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Quote from: EarnOnVictor on April 26, 2023, 08:13:37 AMIf possible on BTT, I believe it's time that we have the 'autosave draft function' on the forum.It has a draft page which has some limitations but you just did not know about it.DraftsDraft page - Pros & ConsIt only works if you either click on Post or Preview button but it has limitation to last 100 posts/ previews and will be available for 7 days.Personally I would like to open Notepad, Microsoft Word to copy and paste my content before click on Post or Preview.If you use Tor, Click on New Tor Circuit for this site, you won't lose the content but it's best to save it in your own draft first.

comments.author: Asiska02
comments.body: Quote from: EarnOnVictor on April 26, 2023, 08:13:37 AMI don't know about you, but I've lost many of my drafted posts/topics due to my multitask attitude, system/browser malfunction, personal error and other reasons, which could be painful.I have had the same experience of losing a reply I have written to be posted because of browser malfunction. Sometimes you can never get it written out again exactly as the first time as the brain tends to skip some words when recalling to write again. Having an auto save draft option will be of great help and would limit loss of posts due to any malfunctions that can tender that. I haven’t had an experience like this when creating topics, since I write them down on phone notebook before bringing it to the forum to post. This is where I then preview and do necessary changes to the post to make it look exactly as I want it to appear in the forum.Quote from: tranthidung on April 26, 2023, 08:27:58 AMDraftsDraft page - Pros & ConsIt only works if you either click on Post or Preview button but it has limitation to last 100 posts/ previews and will be available for 7 days.So drafts works like this too? I always thought only previewed post before posting can only be found on the draft and not the ones posted without previewing first. The period validity of posts and number of posts the draft can take is okay. But what OP wanted was an auto save as you’re typing in a reply post or topic, this won’t solve the problem unless the user is used to clicking on preview often as he/she types.

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: EarnOnVictor on April 26, 2023, 12:19:08 PMWhat if you lose the draft before you have the chance to preview it?I don't expect this autosave to be implemented any time soon, so: click Preview more often  Most of the time, after clicking Preview, even a browser restart doesn't remove the content. In case I keep the draft for a long time (sometimes months), I save the text locally. Once in a while I mess up one of my tabs and lose a draft, but if it's anything substantial, I make sure I used Preview so I can use the draft feature.

comments.author: sokani
comments.body: In the course of writing, my network might disconnect and reconnect causing my browser to reload, thus causing me to lose my typed text or message. What I normally do when writing lengthy message, is to first write it down on a notepad and copy and paste it on the text editor and preview it. By so doing, I would have a copy of the message on my notepad and a draft incase anything goes wrong.
